level1.title: Day 1: Dawn in the Cell
level1.scene:
The pale morning light filters through the narrow prison window, casting long shadows across the cell. You've been in this filthy, cramped hole for three days now. The hard cot has no mattress, and the toilet is just a hole in the corner. For three days, you've been thinking about how to escape from this hellish place.

You have 15 days until your execution.

You hear footsteps in the corridor—probably the shift change for the morning guards. This is an opportunity. You need to make a decision.

A.name: Bribe the Guard
A.description: Slip some coins to the young guard passing by the cell door.

B.name: Inspect the Cell
B.description: Secretly search every corner of your cell for escape opportunities.

C.name: Forge Documents
C.description: Use your magical knowledge to mentally draft a forged pardon document.

A.narrative: You quietly slip some coins through the cell door to the young guard. He looks hesitant at first, but after a moment, he agrees. He promises to bring you something useful during his next shift. The bribe was successful.

B.narrative: You carefully examine every inch of your cell. You notice some indentations in the walls that might be exploitable. The window bars are rusty in places—perhaps they could be broken. You memorize all the details.

C.narrative: You close your eyes and concentrate. Though the prison has magic-suppressing runes, in your mind you can still imagine what a pardon document would look like. You spend some magical energy refining this mental image, hoping it might be useful someday.

level2.title: Level 2: Shadows in the Warehouse
level2.scene: In the warehouse shadows you sense an opportunity. The shift change is approaching and timing matters.

A.name: Steal a Tool
A.description: Take a small tool from the warehouse when no one is watching.

B.name: Talk to a Guard
B.description: Approach a guard and try to learn the patrol schedule.

C.name: Observe the Guards
C.description: Silently observe guard movements to find patterns.

A.narrative: You manage to pocket an iron hook from the storage—dangerous but useful.

B.narrative: You coax patrol times from a guard, useful for planning your actions.

C.narrative: You note additional patrol details that might help later.

level3.title: Level 3: Echoes Beneath the Window
level3.scene: The night echoes outside the window. A brief silence might offer a chance to act.

A.name: Probe the Door Gap
A.description: Gently test the door gap for weaknesses.

B.name: Contact a Fellow Prisoner
B.description: Reach out to another prisoner for help.

C.name: Inspect the Window Bars
C.description: Carefully check the window bars and welds.

A.narrative: You find the hinge loosening—potential leverage for future plans.

B.narrative: You secure a promise of assistance from a fellow prisoner.

C.narrative: A weld on the bars is corroded—an exploitable spot.

level4.title: Level 4: Labor as Cover
level4.scene: A labor detail may let you access key areas under the guise of work.

A.name: Join the Labor Team
A.description: Blend into the labor group to reach weak points.

B.name: Watch Patrols
B.description: Study guard routes to locate blind spots.

C.name: Forge Papers
C.description: Attempt to forge a document that excuses your absence.

A.narrative: You join and identify weak points in the transport route.

B.narrative: You gather more patrol details for later use.

C.narrative: Your forged papers nearly get exposed but grant a brief outing.

level5.title: Level 5: Edge of the Key
level5.scene: A small object might change everything—you plan a first small attempt.

A.name: Small-scale Sabotage
A.description: Damage a simple latch or lock.

B.name: Bribe an Outsider Guard
B.description: Use a small bribe to gain favor with an external guard.

C.name: Collect Evidence
C.description: Collect more information for later use.

A.narrative: You damage a latch and create an opening for future moves.

B.narrative: The guard accepts a small bribe and brings you a small item as thanks.

C.narrative: You collect more evidence that may be useful later.

level6.title: Level 6: Ventilation Clues
level6.scene: A loose vent flutters—maybe an escape route lies behind it.

A.name: Expand Sabotage
A.description: Continue widening the damage in secret.

C.name: Feign Illness
C.description: Feign illness to buy time and reduce suspicion.

A.narrative: You expand the sabotage, creating better conditions for the next step.

B.narrative: You reach an agreement with allies to assist when needed.

C.narrative: Feigning illness earns you extra rest time.

level7.title: Level 7: The Record's Gap
level7.scene: You notice a marginal note in the attendance ledger—could be a loophole.

A.name: Peek the Ledger
A.description: Steal a glance to glean useful entries.

C.name: Forge Records
C.description: Create falsified entries to pass inspection.

A.narrative: You extract valuable details from the ledger.

B.narrative: The clerk accepts a bribe and shares route information.

C.narrative: You forge records successfully, increasing your chance to pass checks.

level8.title: Level 8: Rainy Night's Chance
level8.scene: Rain masks sound and movement—now may be the moment to use it as cover.

C.name: Conserve Stamina
C.description: Wait and conserve your strength for the right moment.

A.narrative: You find signs of a hidden passage—progress is tangible.

B.narrative: Your noise draws guards away briefly, giving you a window to act.

C.narrative: You conserve your energy and wait for a better opportunity.

level9.title: Level 9: Weather as Cover
level9.scene: A storm outside makes it easier to mask your movements—use it wisely.

A.name: Act in the Rain
A.description: Use the rain noise to conceal your actions.

B.name: Delay Action
B.description: Hold back to avoid rushing into danger.

C.name: Seek Help
C.description: Try to send a plea for external assistance.

A.narrative: You leverage the rain to complete a small but crucial task.

B.narrative: You choose patience and preserve your strength.

C.narrative: You manage to earn a brief trust from an outsider who may help.

level10.title: Level 10: The Draft's Value
level10.scene: You find a draft for forged documents—this sample could be valuable.

A.name: Forge a Pass
A.description: Attempt to craft a believable pass.

B.name: Contact Outside
B.description: Look for channels to reach the outside world.

C.name: Keep the Draft
C.description: Hide the sample for later use.

A.narrative: You complete a draft pass and raise your legal skill.

B.narrative: You establish contact that might yield outside aid.

C.narrative: You stash the draft, waiting for the right time.

level11.title: Level 11: The Shift Gap
level11.scene: Shift change mistakes create a small opening—you must decide how to use it.

A.name: Attempt a Breakout
A.description: Use the gap to try a short breakout.

B.name: Wait for Better Timing
B.description: Hold on for a safer moment.

C.name: Distract Guards
C.description: Create a diversion to pull guards away.

A.narrative: You attempt a brief breakout, gaining some ground but losing stamina.

B.narrative: You wait and conserve your strength for future moves.

C.narrative: You successfully distract guards, creating an opportunity.

level12.title: Level 12: Eve of Inspection
level12.scene: A major inspection is coming. Will you act early or hide your tracks?

A.name: Act Early
A.description: Seize the initiative before inspection begins.

B.name: Hide Evidence
B.description: Conceal anything that might be found.

C.name: Ask Allies
C.description: Request critical help from a fellow prisoner.

A.narrative: You act ahead of the inspection and secure a better position.

B.narrative: You successfully hide evidence that would have caused trouble.

C.narrative: You obtain crucial assistance from a comrade.

level13.title: Level 13: The Final Weighing
level13.scene: With execution looming, pressure mounts—you must decide what matters most.

A.name: All-out Action
A.description: Put every plan into motion at once.

B.name: Seek Pardon
B.description: Give up resistance and attempt to secure clemency.

C.name: Contact Outside
C.description: Use resources to attempt outside contact.

A.narrative: You launch a full-scale plan; things are tense but hopeful.

B.narrative: You seek clemency, hoping for a better outcome.

C.narrative: You send a distress signal to the outside and await a response.

level14.title: Level 14: The Secret Passage
level14.scene: You find a hidden passage that might lead outside—will you take it?

A.name: Enter the Passage
A.description: Risk entering the secret passage to try to escape.

B.name: Wait for Night
B.description: Use darkness to cover your move.

C.name: Divide the Guards
C.description: Lead guards away in shifts to secure the passage.

A.narrative: You enter the passage and make progress toward freedom.

B.narrative: You wait for darkness to conserve strength.

C.narrative: You successfully draw guards away and secure the route.

level15.title: Level 15: The Final Day
level15.scene: The last day has come. It's time to make your final move.

A.name: Go All In
A.description: Risk everything in a final attempt to break free.

B.name: Accept Fate
B.description: Give up resistance and spend your remaining time in reflection.

C.name: Spend All Resources
C.description: Use every asset—bribes, evidence, forged papers—to buy a chance.

A.narrative: You risk everything in a final push; the outcome is uncertain.

B.narrative: You accept the end and look back on your life.

C.narrative: You exchange all assets for one last opportunity to survive.
